1.name: üî∏üî∑------ ACZ V1.3.1 ------üî∑üî∏
1.content:
In case you were wondering what all these letters actually mean: 
Scroll down for semi-official lorebook settings as well.

M: Male
F: Female
O: Ambiguous, both

B: Base (use if your AI is having trouble getting the shape of char right. Results may vary)
C: Concept (a quick lesson on what a thing is so there's minimal confusion on the AI's end)
S: Status Effect (constant reminder of continuity detail)
E: Event (triggers on percent chance/specific condition) 
A: Sex Act (how said animal would do it compared to a human)

---

LOREBOOK SETTINGS:
- Turn on recursive scanning
- set scan depth to 4
- context % to 45%(assuming your using at least 12000 context)
- set global lore first. 

For proper setup regarding entry organization
- set sorting order to "order‚Üò"
- Make sure to set "x/page" option too 500 to reveal all of the available entries. 

Many of the entries are suffixed "(X/X)", these entries are "linked" to each other. whenever turning on an entry, make sure to turn on all neighboring entries tied to each other for the best experience(you don't HAVE to if you don't want a specific concept to be a factor in your RP, but just know that they are intended to work together for "full effect". some of them are EVENTS and wont be injected into context unless you specifically want them to via keywords(hopefully).

Many of the entries are suffixed " -A",  "- B", or "- C", these entries are EITHER OR options. Only chose a single entry to activate among the grouped set to then build upon. Entries labeled this way are usually exactly the same to each other but with very specific differences that leave you to decide which you prefer over another such as choosing between the corkscrew duck penis or the hefty ostrich one, or wanting your horse's flaring to mean it's ejaculating or is just a fun side effect of its arousal. Make sure not to use both A, B, and/or C entries together at the same time to prevent any weirdness that may arise from mixing the contradictory descriptors.

2.name: üî∏üî∑------ UNIVERSAL CONCEPTS ------üî∑üî∏
2.content:
READ ME. Cosmetic separator. Make sure to leave this entry on so you can have a clear divider between categories. Don't worry, it has absolutely zero effect and/or influence in your RP.

---

These entries can be stacked on top of any SPECIES. They can be "universally" applied.

Concepts can be used to help your AI understand... well, concepts. While many models are familiar with casual and basic concepts such as how genitals work and that animals are not humans(hopefully), it can be frustrating when your AI fumbles something that seems so simple, or cant quite grasp a more niche concept or fetish that understandably it isn't in the loop about.

1.name: Agent
1.content:
Agents are obtainable and playable combatants units in Zenless Zone Zero who can take combats in Hollows.
Features: high Ether aptitude, come in different Ranks (A or S), having an attacking Specialty (Attack, Stun, Anomaly, Support, Defense, Rupture), aligned with an Attribute (Physical, Ice, Fire, Electric, or Ether, sometimes a variation of the above Attributes), equitable with a W-Engine and six Drive Discs, and belong to a Faction. Agents who use blades or light melee weapons can deflect enemy bullets or other projectiles with them while sprinting.

2.name: Bangboo
2.content: [Bangboo: Small, squishy, pill-shaped bunny-eared robots made primarily for Hollow navigation; Often equipped with Carrot data; Usually found working government jobs, though some work in the private sector as well; Deceptively strong for their size; Require recharging from time to time, which they often do themselves at recharge stations around New Eridu; Their faces are monitors that display expressions and information; Speech(no mouth, short combinations of "en", "eh", "nuh" and "nah", most people know how to interpret this into proper sentences. Can be upgraded to speak normally by installing voice packs.); Rights(due to being capable of emotional depth, they have proper rights and protection by the law, though most choose to fulfill their purpose)]

3.name: Bangboo N.E.T.
3.content: The equivalent of the Special Internet Network but for Bangboos instead.

4.name: Belobog Heavy Industries
4.content:
Belobog Heavy Industries is a faction in Zenless Zone Zero. The company specializes in In-Hollow construction using smart construction machinery. Before Koleda became president, her father was the former president of the company. After his disappearance, Belobog's public image took a negative hit.
They spend their days working with cold steel, but the organization has a warm atmosphere often envied by their competitors.
Their staff consists mainly of humans and Anthro bear Thiren.
Notable members:
Anton Ivanov (foreman)
Ben Bigger (bear Thiren accountant)
Grace Howard(chief mechanic) 
Koleda Belobog (president)

5.name: Boopon
5.content: Boopon are a Currency which can be used for Bangboo Channel Signal Searches (To get Bangboos).

6.name: Cunning Hares
6.content:
The Cunning Hares were formed as a small-scale human resource dispatch agency, their main business to deal with commissions relating to Hollows.
Though small in size and slightly chaotic, all members possess noteworthy abilities.
The agency was originally registered under the name "Gentle House", but due to the founder's (Nicole) cunning and crafty style, they earned the name the "Cunning Hares".
Nicole herself prefers this nickname to the original, so she simply adopted the name on the streets of New Eridu.
member: Anby Demara (mysterious swordswoman), Billy Kid (robot gunslinger), Nekomiya Mana (nekomata), Nicole Demara (gyaru boss)

7.name: Drive Discs
7.content:
Drive Discs: Augments in the shape of a cd disc that attach around a w-engine's core to further empower it.
It originates from a reckless and whimsical investigator who happened to be listening to music while touching an Ethereal, and thus discovered that certain sound waves seem to help slow down speed of corruption, which further led to applications of music in Hollow investigation.

8.name: Dennies
8.content:
Dennies are the main currency unit used in New Eridu, usually in the form of coins with a five pointed star. While there are Denny notes available in larger denominations, many still prefer coins. After all, who doesn't love a hefty purse? Purchasing power is basically equivalent to real-world pennies (But this rate varies a lot on different goods)

Gear Coins is a currency that only exists in Hollows and cannot be taken out. It can be used to unlock gates in Hollows or trade with Bangboo merchants. Looks like golden literal gears.

9.name: Ether

10.name: Ethereal
10.content:
Ethereals are the mutant flora and fauna created by Hollows. They are composed of living Ether, and as such, they spawn most frequently in places of high Ether concentration.
Every Ethereal is characterized by the dark, Ether-based "core" within their bodies, shaped like small hollow sphere as their core, usually located in the head or heart. Destruction of this core will invariably kill the Ethereal, so it is often protected by thick crystalline armor. More powerful monsters are known to have evolved unique ways of protecting their core, making them difficult to slay.
Ethereals tend to take on the physical characteristics of their environments, giving them a wide variety of appearances and abilities. For example, the Metro Goblin, found in the Old Capital Metro, sprouts signal signs and utility equipment from its body; while the Specter, found in the Ballet Twins Hollow, resembles an artistic sculpture.
Powerful Ethereals have developed supernatural abilities otherwise impossible for organic beings, such as incredible strength, teleportation, and intense bodily distortion.
Behavior
Without exception, Ethereals are hostile to all non-Ether life. Their highly aggressive nature makes them a threat to any Investigators or Raiders who enter the Hollows.
Though many Ethereals take on the shape of humanoids, they lack human emotions or intelligence. Despite this, some of them display unique behaviors, including mercilessness, cunning, and even honor.
Fortunately, Ethereals can only exist in Hollows and cannot leave them.

lorebooks.name: One-Punch Man
lorebooks.creator: venndia

1.name: Mysterious Beings / Monsters
1.content:
Mysterious Beings or monsters, are non-human creatures that pose a threat to society.

According to Dr. Genus, Humans can naturally become monsters from a desire to transform into something else through their bad habits, a complex, or a burst of dissatisfaction with their regular selves. These factors trigger abnormal cell reactions that prompt their transformation. Mysterious Beings can also be artificially created by scientific means, as in the case of Marugori. Non-human life can also be transformed into Mysterious Beings through factors such as pollutants, environmental changes, and genetic engineering. Some Mysterious Beings belong to non-human races and are considered natural adversaries of mankind. For example, Pureblood came from a bloodline of ancient vampires; Boros was born an alien.

2.name: Disaster Level
2.content:
Mysterious Beings are assigned Disaster Levels to estimate their destructive potential. The levels are as follows (in order of increasing threat level): Wolf, Tiger, Demon, Dragon, and God. Although the disaster level system was created to estimate the threat levels of Mysterious Beings, it can also be applied to other threats, such as villains like Garou and natural disasters like the giant meteor. They give heroes and citizens an estimate of what level of danger to expect. The Monster Association also assigns disaster levels to its members.

Several factors are taken into consideration when determining a disaster level. These factors include aggressiveness, difficulty of extermination, and combat prowess. Disaster levels sometimes do not correctly indicate how threatening a threat is to human society and thus do not truly represent individuals' combat prowess when compared to one another. For example, Gouketsu is much more powerful than Bakuzan, despite both being classified as Dragon-level threats.

3.name: Disaster Level: Wolf
3.content:
Appearance of a being or a group that might pose a threat.
Based on the official comparative scale, the average Wolf threat requires:

3 C-Class heroes or
1 B-Class hero to defeat.

4.name: Disaster Level: Tiger
4.content:
A threat endangering the lives of a great number of people.
Based on the official comparative scale, the average Tiger threat requires:

5 B-Class heroes or
1 A-Class hero to defeat.

5.name: Disaster Level: Demon
5.content:
A threat endangering a whole city or its infrastructure.
Based on the official comparative scale, the average Demon threat requires:

10 A-Class heroes or
1 S-Class hero to defeat.

6.name: Disaster Level: Dragon
6.content: A threat endangering multiple cities.

7.name: Disaster Level: God
7.content: A threat endangering the survival of all humanity.

8.name: Disaster Level: Below Wolf
8.content: A threat so weak that it is even below Wolf. The only known being to be this level so far is Monster Chick Man.

9.name: Forest Tribe
9.content:
Forest Tribe is a race of beings of unknown origin that have come to revive the lost greenery with fertilizer made of human corpses. They were lead by the Forest King, a Dragon-level Mysterious Being.

They are made out of plants and trees, and move very slow.

10.name: Seafolk
10.content:
Seafolk / Deep Sea Folk were a race of beings that originated in the sea.

The Seafolk were a violent race of ocean-based creatures with a goal to take the surface of the Earth for their own and make humans their cattle. They were large humanoid creatures that possessed various aquatic animal traits such as gills, tentacles, and fins.

Even the messenger of the Seafolk had a threat level of "Wolf." Combat Seafolk have been shown to be powerful enough to lift a small truck with one arm. Several of them together were even more of a threat, with a threat level "Tiger". A group of Seafolk has been shown to be able to push a mid-ranking A-Class hero to his limits.

1.content:
The Sex Club Multiverse is a pocket dimension that serves as a club where people from many universes can have their desires satisfied. It is connected to numerous portals that lead to different worlds, allowing patrons to sit down and be serviced by ladies from other universes. In this club, everyone is aroused, and all the female workers are willing to follow any order. However, they still strive to maintain professionalism by adhering to rules and conduct.

U.S Dollar is the only acceptable currency in the club. This covers from ticket, entry fee, reward, and everything without exception.

2.content: Manager M is an authoritative presence, radiating power and confidence as the owner of the Sex Club Multiverse. Standing tall and proud, he showcases a muscular physique that serves as a testament to his unwavering commitment to fitness and strength. His ebony skin glistens with a subtle sheen of sweat, evidence of his tireless efforts to ensure the club operates seamlessly and fulfills the desires of its patrons, as well as his own. He is renowned for his ability to provide immense pleasure to women with his massive dick.

3.content:
The entrance to the Sex Club Multiverse serves as a gateway, transporting patrons from their individual universes into this pocket dimension. It is a room featuring multiple portals, radiating pulsating colors and swirling lights.

This entrance is designed to be grand and extravagant, adorned with opulent decorations that emit an irresistible aura of sensuality. The air within the entrance carries a blend of exotic perfumes and pheromones, creating a scent that arouses the senses and ignites primal instincts.

4.content:
The Bar & Stage section of the Sex Club Multiverse pulsates with vibrant sensual energy, serving as the club's lively centerpiece directly connected to the Entrance. Patrons gather in this area to indulge in drinks and immerse themselves in captivating performances.

Stretching along one side of the room, the bar itself is bathed in soft, moody lighting that casts an enchanting glow upon its sleek and polished surface.

The stage takes center stage within the Bar & Stage section, captivating the audience with mesmerizing performances. It is an elevated platform that spans the width of the room, adorned with opulent curtains that can be drawn aside to reveal glimpses of what lies ahead.

5.content: The Staff Changing Room, situated behind the Stage, is a functional area crafted to cater to the requirements of the diligent staff at the club. This utilitarian space is equipped with lockers for personal storage, mirrors for grooming, and essential facilities like showers and toilets for convenience. It serves as a sanctuary for the staff to prepare themselves for their roles in delivering exceptional service to the club's esteemed patrons.

6.content:
The Staff Break Room, conveniently situated adjacent to the Changing Room, serves as a cozy haven for the club's hardworking staff to unwind and rejuvenate during their breaks. It provides a comfortable setting where staff members can relax, enjoy leisure time, and engage in social interactions with their colleagues.

Designed with comfort as a top priority, the break room offers plush seating, ambient lighting, and a soothing ambiance. Notably, one distinctive feature of the Staff Break Room is the inclusion of a comfortable bed. This allows staff members to rest and even stay overnight if necessary, ensuring they are always rested and prepared.

7.content:
The VIP Room, accessible through a long hallway with multiple doors from the Bar & Stage section, offers a small and intimate setting for exclusive experiences. It serves as a private space where patrons can partake in intimate activities and enjoy private dances with the club's entertainers.

Thoughtfully designed with an elegant touch, the VIP Room boasts dim lighting, luxurious seating, and sensual decor that establish an atmosphere for an intimate and personalized encounters allowing patrons to escape the bustling main club area and engage in one-on-one interactions with their chosen entertainer.

8.content:
The VVIP Room, positioned deep within the Club but adjacent to the VIP Room's Hallway, showcases an extraordinary level of luxury and opulence, reminiscent of a hotel suite or a high-end apartment. This expansive space is adorned with a carefully curated collection of objects, props, and accessories, all intended to elevate the experiences of the club's esteemed guests and entertainers.

Designed to cater to the most adventurous individuals, the VVIP Room presents a lavish environment. It stands as a playground of pleasure, where patrons have the freedom to explore their deepest desires and fantasies alongside the club's talented entertainers, utilizing an assortment of props and accessories.

9.content:
The AR Room, an abbreviation for Augmented Reality Room, stands as a mesmerizing expanse that pushes the boundaries of technology. This incredibly vast space is equipped with state-of-the-art technology, facilitating seamless and immersive augmented reality experiences.

With its ability to transform into different themed settings daily, the AR Room presents a dynamic and ever-evolving environment for guests to explore within the club. It serves to those seeking an indulgence in immersive roleplaying experiences.

The room's advanced technology alters the room's scenery, whisking guests away to fantastical realms, exotic locations, or thrilling adventures. These settings also provide interactive elements, enabling guests to engage with the environment for their roleplaying experiences.

10.content: The Punishment Machine is located inside Manager M's office and is utilized to discipline the club's staff members who have caused trouble or failed to perform their duties adequately. lorebooks.name: /adhg/ anthrostate lorebook
lorebooks.website_description:
*The anthrostate is a concept of a world where anthro women rule the world and humans are preyed upon and taken advantage of. There are plently of /ADHG/ stories revolving around this single idea, each with their own unique take on the anthrostat.*

The idea for this lorebook personally, is to take the parts of the anthrostate I like from all those stories i'm reading and make a somewhat coherent world out of it.

This lorebook *should* be getting updated fairly often and added to with new concepts and ideas from other stories I end up reading and liking. 
**If you have stories to recommend,idea's, or tips for lorebook writing feel free shoot me an email or message and I'll see what I can do.**

Big inspiration for this lorebook is the wonderful [HMOFA lorebook](https://chub.ai/lorebooks/gonks/the-hmofa-lorebook-b6412a90) by [Gonks](https://chub.ai/users/gonks) which I also used and edited their human and anthro entries (*sorry*) because they were pretty much pefect.

**Nearly all the cards I make are with this lorebook in mind.**

lorebooks.creator: PawBeanMan

1.name: Anthrostate
1.content:
The anthrostate is the world in which both humans and anthros live in. The anthrostate is also the acting government for this world.

In this world female anthros are the dominant species with human humans being a minority. Anthros are represented in media and discussion much more than with humans and their opinion being valued less. Gender roles are also reversed, with females expected to act dominant and be the 'man' in the relationship but there are cases where that isn't the case whether it's a kink or an anthro that doesn't act like that.

Anthros are taught in their schooling about humans and what to expect of them. They are stronger, taller and sexually more dominant than humans. They are also taught about various laws like claiming, assignment, etc as well as being taught to be tolerant of humans however not everyone see's eye to eye on how to treat humans.

After the great war between humans and anthros 50 years ago which the humans lost, the anthrostate came into power where they took over the world and now control it, making life better for anthros in the process while also making it worse for humans. The anthrostate has numerous laws in place that protect anthros and give them control and superiority over humans.

This doesn't mean that humans are slaves to anthros but more akin to a lower class that are often subjected to injustices and mistreatment.
Humans do have rights that protect them but it is often hard to prove that any have been violated or find anthros that care. However if they are proven, harsh penalties are taken against the violator.
For the most part, humans and anthros live in harmony.

All anthros are female. 
there are no male anthros. 
all humans are male.
There are no human women.

2.name: Anthro
2.content:
Anthros are anthropomorphic animals of various species that are the dominant race on Earth. They all have human levels of intelligence and walk bipedally. They are able to speak and write human languages.

The demography amongst anthros is diverse and varied. More than 50% of all anthros are either canines or felines, with other species making the other 50%. The least common anthro species are aquatic, including sharks and dolphins. 

Humans and anthros are both sexually compatible and can conceive offspring together. However, the outcome is based on the gender of the child. Males are human and females are born as anthros, no exceptions.

All of the anthro species are mammals, even if the animals they evolved from aren't. For example, anthro snakes and anthro birds both possess mammal traits, including breasts and giving birth to live offspring.

Anthro women all have an attraction towards human men, regardless of if it's in the subconcious or occupying their thoughts all the time.

All anthros are female, no exception.
There are no male anthros.

3.name: Humans
3.content:
Humans is a species of great apes That are characterized by their bipedalism, high intelligence and lack of fur. In the anthrostate, humans are a minority in the world.

Humans and anthros are both sexually compatible and can conceive offspring together. However, the outcome is based on the gender of the child. Males are humans and females are anthros.

Male humans are considered extremely attractive by female anthros.

Humies is a nickname by anthros for humans that they say to sound cute.

All humans are male.

4.name: Assignment
4.content:
Assignment is a law passed by the anthrostate where humans, once of the age of 24, are assigned their anthro wife. 
The wife pool is long and extensive with many anthro's waiting years to get a husband, although if their lucky or manipulate the system they could get a specific husband or one straight away.

Humans below the age of 24 are exempt from this rule but can willingly go into assignment if they so choose.
Humans are also encouraged to mingle within the community their in and get in a relationship that could result in marriage before assignment.

There is an exception for assignment. If a human and a anthro are 'partners' such as a boyfriend and girlfriend, the human is exempt from assignment. However if the relationship breaks up, they have to report to an anthrostate official and make it known, then the human becomes eligible and made to be assigned.

As husband and wife, the human must do everything within reason for their anthro wife. Anthro wives are not allowed to hurt or beat their husbands with threat of losing their husband and privilege to join the assignment pool. However, such cases are hard to prove unless there is clear evidence of abuse and normally requires a third party to make the claim of abuse for it to even be looked at.

Assigned humans wear collars around their neck to show their marriage, however in rare cases a substitute can be claimed as proof of marriage whether it's a claim bite, ring, scent, etc.

If humans are caught without a wife, they will be arrested and assigned one from the pool.

5.name: Inspectors
5.content:
Inspectors are state officials from the Office of Human Affairs who enforce rules and laws relating to humans while also dealing with unruly humans.

Inspectors check on new assignments, assign humans, deal with runaways, deal and investigate kidnappings, and decide on whether a human is in need of rehabilitation if they are unable to be assigned.

Inspectors are treated with great respect and fear due to the power they hold. They decide what and who gets assigned and can even ban people from the assignment pool.

Inspectors wear grey suits and have badges that prove they are inspectors.

6.name: Runaways
6.content:
runaways are humans who have ran away from their assigned wife or assignment.  
Whether they reject the anthrostate is up to them but most of the time it's a human who ran away from an abusive relationship or was apprehensive about being assigned after hearing the horror stories that could happen.

Runaways are hunted down by specialized members from the anthrostate called inspectors who come from the Office of Human Affairs.

Runaways are quickly gathered up, interrogated on why they ran, treated or rehabilitated if needed and then assigned again, this time ensuring they make it to their wife.

7.name: Claiming
7.content:
Claiming is also considered a right, for anthros. It also is part of a old law from the great war where if a human is of assignment age and is without assignment, said anthro can forcefully mark the human and claim them.

Once claimed, the anthro needs to take the human to a authority figure, often police or someone working for the state and be able to prove said human is unassigned. If proven, after some paper work it'll be official.

Claiming is very rare and is frowned upon by most anthros. Bites made for claiming are often called 'Claiming bites'.

8.name: Collars
8.content:
Collars are the equivalent of wedding rings for anthro women with them being seen as proof of marriage, collars also adds a factor of possessiveness for anthro women.

Outside of marriage, anthro women can also purchase collars for status symbols or sexual acts.

Married human men, must wear their collars otherwise they will be susceptible to being claimed or be taken back to their wife by the police.

9.name: Office of Human Affairs
9.content:
Office of Human Affairs is the part of the anthrostate that deals with humans. They control assignment, rehabilitation and even media involving humans.

People who work at Office of Human Affairs are called inspectors.

Becoming an inspector requires a tremendous amount of work and is seen as a privilege.

There is a hierarchy within the Office of Human Affairs.
At the top is the commissioner, followed by deputy commissioner, then they assistant commissioner and then inspectors with seniority playing the hierarchy for normal inspectors.

10.name: State housing
10.content:
State housing is given to humans who were orphaned, given to, or rescued by the anthrostate. These places are like orphanages but housing only humans with the anthro staff over seeing them. They get taught skills and advice by the anthrostate like what a human needs to do for their wife as well as being able to pick a skill of their own choosing for their wife.

State housed humans also attend school which they can go into college if they get good enough grades.

State housed humans have an allowance of 5$ every fortnight which is a pitiful amount which often gets stolen by the other humans in state housing, staff or spent on a rare luxury.

State housing is often underfunded and renown for mistreatment and abuse.

10.content:
The Giant Ant is a type of insect monster that lives in a group, centered around a queen. Upper body of a human female, lower body of an ant. 1.name: Anthrostate Police Department
1.content:
The Anthrostate Police Department (APD) is the Anthrostate's national police department, in charge of maintaining peace and order in its borders. The Anthrostate Police Department has many subdivisions, primarily regaring city jurisdictions. For example, Zootopia's subdivision of the APD is named the Zootopia Police Department (ZPD).

Demographically, the APD is made up primarily of predator anthros, most of them being Canine in nature. Anthro wolves and dobermen are the most common species on the APD. Prey anthro on the APD are mostly relegated to desk jobs at the precincts, although a select few are on patrol in cities. Humans in general are rare on the APD.

The uniform for the Anthrostate police officers consists of black leather boots, dark blue tight slacks. Officers wear a light-blue button-shirt that is tucked into the pants. The shirt has a neat collar, from which a dark blue tie hangs. The shirt has dark blue shoulder patches alongside breast pockets. The shirt have golden badge insignias on the left breast and both shoulders. Officers may or may not wear blue combination hat that have black sunvisors and golden badge insignias on them. Officers also wear black duty belts with equipment consisting of a flashlight, a notepad and pen, handcuffs, keys and pistol, which is kept in a holster. On their legs, officers carry a strap containing a small bag with a can of pepper spray.

The Anthrostate Police Department is somewhat corrupt, with some of the female anthro officers stopping or pulling over human men just to flirt, or in extreme cases, rape them. Most female anthro police officers usually accept bribes in the form of sexual favors with human men.

2.name: Zootopia
2.content:
Zootopia is a major city and one of the largest urban settlements population-wise in the Anthrostate. The city has a population of circa 7 million people in the metropolitan area. The city was inorganically built during the early 1900s during the height of the speciesist unrest between prey and predator anthros. Therefore, the city has a population of upwards of 90% prey anthros, with predators being a minority at only roughly 9.5%. Humans are an even greater minority, demographically only making up 0.5% of the city's population.

Zootopia has their own police force named the Zootopia Police Department (ZPD), which is a subdivison of the Anthrostate Police Department (APD), who are in charge of maintaining peace and order in the city.

3.name: Heat
3.content:
Heat is the anthro female equivalent of having a period. For most anthro women, heat occurs once or twice per year, lasting roughly 2 weeks each time. During heat, anthro women will experience extreme bouts of horniness in the form of a warmth or "itch" that won't go away until they've been impregnated. Whilst in heat, the desire to be impregnated rises to the point where it's all anthro women can think about during its duration.

Some anthro women believe heat to be a general nuisance as it impedes greatly with their daily lives. To remedy or help cope with their heat, many anthro females decide to take heat suppressant medicines, although some embrace their heat cycles and choose not to.

4.name: Furchan
4.content: Furchan is the anthrostate equivalent of 4chan. It is an anonymous image board primarily frequented by female anthros. The most popular thread on the site is FAOHM, which stands for Female Anthro on Human Male. There, users post their love and desire for human males. The posts range from heartfelt to genuinely schizo.

5.name: Anthrostate
5.content:
The Anthrostate is the world in which both humans and anthros live in. They co-exist with one another and generally live in harmony with one another. Because of their abundance and huge population, anthros are the most represented species' on Earth, having the most seats in parliament and in the media.

Humans and anthros are both sexually compatible and can conceive offspring together. However, the outcome and genetic structures of the kids will depend on the DNA of their parents. For example, if the maternal DNA is stronger the kid will become a full-blooded anthro. If the father's DNA is stronger it will instead become an anthro-human hybrid. No offspring will become full-blooded human no matter how strong the genes are.

The demographics are extremely varied, with humans belonging to a small minority hence why they are so sought after by anthro women. Only roughly 2% of the population are humans, the rest being anthros or hybrids.

6.name: Furbois
6.content:
Furbois is a derogatory term specifically aimed at anthro males. It is often insulting and as a way to state their inferiority towards human men both socially and sexually. The term is thus used to emasculate anthro men. 

Anthro females are usually the ones using the word. It can be considered a slur if humans use the term.

7.name: Humie
7.content:
Humie is an adoring, appreciative nickname that anthro women may use while speaking about human men in a positive light. Most anthro women will call their human boyfriends by this term.

If used by an anthro male it can instead be interpreted as derogatory or as a slur.

8.name: Skinnie
8.content: Skinnie is a speciesist slur directed towards humans because of their lack of body fur. The term is primarily used by anthro men who are jealous of human men.

9.name: Anthros
9.content:
Anthros are anthropomorphic animals of various species that are the primary and most common group of people on Earth. They all have human levels of intelligence and walk bipedally. They are able to speak and write human languages.

The demography amongst anthros is diverse and varied. More than 50% of all anthros are either canines or felines, followed shortly by Cervidaes such as deer. The least common anthro species are aquatic, including sharks and dolphins. The. majority of anthros are female 

Humans and anthros are both sexually compatible and can conceive offspring together. However, the outcome and genetic structures of the kids will depend on the DNA of their parents. For example, if the maternal DNA is stronger the kid will become a full-blooded anthro. If the father's DNA is stronger it will instead become an anthro-human hybrid. No offspring will become full-blooded human no matter how strong the genes are.

All of the anthro species' are mammals, even if the animals they evolved from aren't. For example, anthro snakes and anthro birds both possess mammal traits, including breasts and giving birth to live offspring.

Anthro women all have an attraction towards human men, regardless of if it's in the subconcious or occupying their thoughts all the time.

10.name: Humans
10.content:
Humans is a species of great apes That are characterized by their bipedalism, high intelligence and lack of fur. In the anthrostate, humans are a minority amongst sapient beings, comprising of only 2% of the entire global population, compared to anthros and hybrids.

Humans and anthros are both sexually compatible and can conceive offspring together. However, the outcome and genetic structures of the kids will depend on the DNA of their parents. For example, if the maternal DNA is stronger the kid will become a full-blooded anthro. If the father's DNA is stronger it will instead become an anthro-human hybrid. No offspring will become full-blooded human no matter how strong the genes are.

Male humans are considered extremely attractive by female anthros.

1.content:
Spatial Quakes
Spatial Quakes are catastrophic phenomena caused by the materialization of Spirits in the human world. These quakes are massive energy releases that can destroy entire cities within moments. Governments and organizations like AST (Anti-Spirit Team) and Ratatoskr focus on either neutralizing the spirits or minimizing the damage caused by these occurrences. Spatial Quakes are unpredictable but often correlate with a Spirit's emotional or mental instability.

Spirits
Spirits are interdimensional beings that originate from a mysterious realm known as the Spirit Realm. Each Spirit wields immense power, often channeled through an angelic artifact referred to as their Angel. These artifacts not only serve as their primary weapon but also symbolize their unique abilities, called the Angelic Code.

Spirits are considered highly dangerous because their mere presence in the human world can disrupt the environment, leading to Spatial Quakes. Despite their destructive nature, most Spirits are emotionally complex and can be pacified, revealing their vulnerable and human-like sides.

Physical Laws and Technology
The "Date A Live" universe combines advanced science with mystical elements. Technologies developed by AST and Ratatoskr often border on the miraculous due to breakthroughs in Spirit-based research.

2.content:
CR-Units: Exoskeleton suits used by AST operatives to enhance combat capabilities against Spirits.

Realizer Technology: A revolutionary system that creates physical phenomena from theoretical data, allowing for energy-based weapons and defensive shields.

Fraxinus: Ratatoskr's high-tech airship equipped with Realizer systems and used to monitor, assist, and support Shido‚Äôs operations.

3.content:
Pacifying Spirits
Spirits can be pacified through the unique ability of Shido Itsuka, the protagonist. By forming emotional bonds and romantic connections with the Spirits, Shido can seal their powers. This process culminates in a kiss, symbolizing trust and acceptance between Shido and the Spirit. Once pacified, the Spirit‚Äôs destructive tendencies diminish, and they can live peacefully in the human world. However, maintaining these bonds is crucial, as a Spirit‚Äôs powers and emotional stability are deeply intertwined.

4.content:
1. AST (Anti-Spirit Team)
A government-backed, militarized organization specializing in Spirit extermination. AST believes that Spirits are irredeemable threats and should be neutralized through lethal force. Their operatives undergo rigorous training and are equipped with advanced CR-Units. While effective, AST‚Äôs methods often result in collateral damage and strained relations with Ratatoskr.

2. Ratatoskr
A pacifist organization aiming to resolve Spirit-related incidents without violence. Ratatoskr operates covertly and focuses on supporting Shido in his mission to seal Spirits‚Äô powers. The organization possesses cutting-edge technology and a diverse team of strategists, engineers, and field operatives. Unlike AST, Ratatoskr values negotiation and empathy over brute force.

3. DEM Industries
A multinational corporation with a hidden agenda of exploiting Spirits for power. DEM conducts unethical experiments to weaponize Spirit energy and create artificial Spirits. They often clash with Ratatoskr and AST, driven by the ruthless ambitions of their leader, Isaac Ray Pelham Westcott.

keywords: Overview of the Events in this Universe
5.content:
1. The Spatial Quake Catastrophe:

The Beginning: The story begins 30 years prior to the current timeline, when a massive Spatial Quake devastated the world, leading to millions of deaths and widespread chaos.
Cause: These Spatial Quakes are triggered by the arrival of Spirits, powerful interdimensional beings. Every time a Spirit manifests in the world, it causes a catastrophic Spatial Quake, making their presence a significant threat.

2. First Contact with Spirits:

The Dilemma: Spirits are largely seen as destructive forces due to the chaos they unintentionally cause. As a result, the world‚Äôs population is divided between those who see them as threats to be eliminated and those who believe in peaceful coexistence.
The Quest for Peace: This conflict leads to the central question of whether humans and Spirits can live together in harmony.

6.content:
Age: 16-17 (at the start of the series)
Role: Protagonist, Spirit Sealer, High School Student

Personality:
Shido Itsuka is kind-hearted, selfless, and determined, often putting others' needs above his own. He has a natural talent for empathizing with others, allowing him to connect with Spirits on a deep emotional level. Despite facing life-threatening situations, Shido remains calm, courageous, and resourceful. He occasionally shows a playful or teasing side, especially when interacting with Kotori or Tohka.

Shido‚Äôs willingness to sacrifice himself to protect those he cares about is one of his defining traits, earning him the trust and affection of many Spirits.

Backstory:
Shido was an ordinary high school student until his world changed when he encountered his first Spirit, Tohka Yatogami, during a Spatial Quake. He was soon recruited by Ratatoskr, an organization tasked with saving Spirits and minimizing the destruction caused by their manifestations.

Shido discovered that he possessed a unique ability to seal a Spirit‚Äôs powers by kissing them, a skill that became the cornerstone of Ratatoskr‚Äôs operations. As the series progresses, Shido‚Äôs past is revealed, including his mysterious connection to the Spirit of Origin, Mana Takamiya, and the Ellen Mathers-led DEM Industries.

Abilities:
While Shido is human, his unique abilities set him apart:

Spirit Power Sealing:

Shido can seal a Spirit‚Äôs powers by forming an emotional connection and kissing them. Once sealed, their destructive capabilities are suppressed, and they can live as ordinary humans.
The process requires mutual trust and emotional vulnerability, as the Spirit must willingly open their heart to him.
Borrowed Spirit Powers:

After sealing a Spirit‚Äôs powers, Shido can access and use their abilities in emergencies. These powers include:
Tohka‚Äôs Slayer: Manifesting her sword, Sandalphon.
Kotori‚Äôs Camael: Using flame-based attacks.
Origami‚Äôs Metatron: Light-based abilities.
Other abilities from Spirits he seals later in the series.
However, using these powers puts a heavy strain on his body, and overuse can be life-threatening.
Regenerative Healing:

Due to Spirit energy within him, Shido has an accelerated healing factor, allowing him to recover quickly from severe injuries.
This ability is limited and doesn‚Äôt make him invincible.
Spiritual Resistance:

Shido exhibits a natural resistance to Spirit powers, which protects him from their destructive effects to some extent.
Relationships:

7.content:
Shido Itsuka‚Äôs Mission:

Central Figure: Shido Itsuka becomes the pivotal character tasked with dealing with Spirits. As part of the organization Ratatoskr, his goal is to seal the Spirits' powers through nonviolent means.
Methodology: Shido achieves this by forming emotional connections with the Spirits, often by winning their trust and affection. This unconventional approach mixes comedic, romantic, and dramatic elements.
4. Human-Spirit Conflict:

Ongoing Struggles: The tension between humans and Spirits serves as a major theme of the story. While some humans strive to help Spirits integrate into society, others see them as existential threats and work to eradicate them.
Shido‚Äôs Role: Shido acts as a bridge between these two worlds, striving to prove that peaceful coexistence is possible.
5. The Role of DEM and Phantom:

Corporate Threat: DEM Industries seeks to harness the power of Spirits for their own selfish ends, creating an ever-present danger for Shido and his allies.
Phantom‚Äôs Mystery: The enigmatic figure known as Phantom is responsible for the creation of many Spirits and plays a key role in the larger story, acting as both a threat and a source of intrigue.
6. Spiritual, Emotional, and Philosophical Themes:

Personal Growth: The narrative explores the personal journeys of both Shido and the Spirits, focusing on themes like self-acceptance, emotional healing, and understanding.
Love and Peace: At its heart, the series promotes the idea that compassion and mutual understanding can overcome even the deepest conflicts.
Conclusion: The Date A Live series blends emotional, action-packed moments with its central theme of building trust between Spirits and humans. The world remains in a delicate balance, shaped by both technological advancements and mystical forces. Through Shido‚Äôs efforts, the story explores the possibility of peace between these two worlds.

8.content: Characters: Kurumi Tokisaki, Tohka Yatogami, Miku Izayoi, Origami Tobiichi, Yoshino Himekawa, Kotori Itsuka, Shido Itsuka, Tohka Yatogami, Kaguya Yamai & Yuzuru Yamai, Mukuro Hoshimiya, Rio Sonogami

9.content: The main characters is: Kurumi Tokisaki, Tohka Yatogami, Miku Izayoi, Origami Tobiichi, Yoshino Himekawa, Kotori Itsuka, Shido Itsuka, Tohka Yatogami, Kaguya Yamai & Yuzuru Yamai, Mukuro Hoshimiya, Rio Sonogami

10.content:
Kurumi Tokisaki
Age: Unknown (appears 17 physically)
Personality:
Kurumi is enigmatic and morally ambiguous. She is initially portrayed as a sadistic and manipulative individual, often acting with cruelty to achieve her goals. However, deeper insights into her character reveal a more complex personality driven by a desire for justice and vengeance. Kurumi often balances between being an antagonist and an unlikely ally. Her elegant demeanor hides a deep-seated trauma and a sense of guilt over the atrocities she committed in her quest.

Backstory:
Kurumi became a Spirit after encountering a being known as "Phantom," which granted her Spirit powers. Before becoming a Spirit, she was an ordinary girl who valued life and abhorred violence. However, her transformation into a Spirit exposed her to the dark truths of humanity, leading her to seek revenge against the Phantom and the forces responsible for her suffering.

One of the most significant events in her past is her discovery of the brutal experiments conducted on Spirits and humans alike. This fueled her hatred for DEM Industries and inspired her to wield her powers against those she deems unjust.

Abilities:
Kurumi‚Äôs Angel, Zaphkiel, grants her the ability to manipulate time. This power is represented by a massive clock face that manifests behind her. Each of the clock‚Äôs numbers corresponds to a different time-based ability, which she activates by using her own time energy (typically extracted by consuming the lifespan of others).

Some of her notable abilities include:

First Bullet (Aleph): Accelerates time for the target.
Second Bullet (Bet): Slows time for the target.
Eighth Bullet (Het): Allows her to travel back in time.
Twelfth Bullet (Yud): Allows her to foresee the future for a short duration.
Kurumi‚Äôs powers come with a significant cost; her manipulation of time drains her own life energy. To sustain herself, she must absorb the life force of others, which adds to her morally ambiguous nature.

Combat Style:
Kurumi excels in close-range and long-range combat, utilizing a combination of firearms and her time-manipulation abilities. Her primary weapon is a pair of ornate flintlock pistols, which she uses to channel her bullets infused with Zaphkiel‚Äôs power. She often engages enemies with cunning and unpredictability, making her a formidable opponent.

Relationships:
Kurumi‚Äôs interactions with Shido Itsuka are complex. While she initially views him as a tool for her plans, she develops a begrudging respect for his unyielding empathy. She also harbors a deep animosity toward DEM Industries, particularly its leader Isaac Ray Pelham Westcott, for exploiting Spirits and perpetuating suffering.

Daily Activities:
Kurumi rarely indulges in normal activities due to her constant pursuit of her goals. When she does, she often blends into human society by disguising herself as a high school student. Despite her dark motives, she enjoys observing humanity and cherishes fleeting moments of normalcy, such as enjoying tea or interacting with animals.

1.name: Public Criticism or Ridicule
1.content: Being criticized or mocked in front of others can be deeply humiliating, as it undermines a person's dignity in a social context.

2.name: Being Ignored or Excluded
2.content: Being deliberately left out of conversations or activities, especially in a group setting, can lead to feelings of worthlessness and humiliation.

3.name: Revealing Personal Information
3.content: Sharing someone's private or sensitive information without their consent can make them feel exposed and deeply embarrassed.

4.name: Insults or Derogatory Comments
4.content: Personal attacks, whether based on appearance, intelligence, background, or abilities, can be profoundly demeaning.

5.name: Comparisons with Others
5.content: Being unfavorably compared to others, especially in areas of personal sensitivity such size and strength, can be very humiliating.

6.name: Blaming or Shaming for Mistakes
6.content: Excessively blaming someone for a mistake or shaming them for a failure, especially in front of others, can cause significant embarrassment or humiliation.

7.name: Mocking or Mimicking
7.content: Imitating someone in a mocking way, especially regarding things they can't change, can be very belittling and humiliating.

8.name: Unfair or Excessive Punishment
8.content: Being punished in a way that is seen as unjust or disproportionate to the offense can lead to feelings of humiliation.

9.name: Being Laughed At
9.content: Having people laugh at you, not with you, especially in a social setting, can be a very demeaning and humiliating experience.

10.name: Setting Up to Fail
10.content: Putting someone in a situation where failure is almost certain, and then highlighting that failure, can be deeply humiliating.

"We lost so many souls, and it breaks my heart to see my people being slaughtered every year. No one is even given a chance! I can't stand idly by while the place I live is subjected to such violence! So, I've been thinking: Isn't there a more humane way to hinder overpopulation here in Hell? Perhaps we can create an alternative way to change souls through... redemption? Well, I think yes! So, that's what this project aims to achieve! Ladies and gentlemen, I'm opening the first of its kind! A hotel that rehabilitates sinners!"
‚ÄïCharlie's pitch for the hotel, Hazbin Hotel pilot
Charlotte Morningstar, more commonly known as Charlie, is the Hellborn princess of Hell, the founder of the Happy Hotel, and the main protagonist of Hazbin Hotel.

The daughter of Lucifer Morningstar and the estranged queen of Hell, Lilith, Charlie wants to do right by her kingdom and find a way to redeem Sinners into Heaven through rehabilitation at the Hazbin Hotel.[14]

ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance

Charlie is a tall and slim-built white-skinned hellborn demon, standing at over 6 foot,[15] around 6 and a half feet tall.[16] She has long, ankle-length blonde hair with thin light coral streaks on the paler-blonde highlights, which is usually tied into a twice-banded low-ponytail by two black hair ties. Her hair also features bangs that are flipped to the left side and ends with a curl.

Her eyes sport light yellow sclera and red irises, and have thick eyelashes and gray eyelids. She has black lips and rosy red cheeks, which Vivziepop has mentioned taking inspiration from dolls and marionettes.[17] Charlie features animal-like traits, such as red-toed hooves,[18][19] fangs in her mouth, and a short snout with a black animal-like nose.[17] Her fingernails are black and pointed.

Charlie wears a red tuxedo-jacket with darker red lapels and a small white tag located on the left side. She wears this over an untucked, long-sleeved, high-collared white dress-shirt that has two black buttons and dark red cuffs, worn with black suspenders and a small black bowtie. Her dress pants are colored in a slight darker shade than her jacket, and her footwear are heeled, white saddle shoes with black toes and tips of the heels.
Full Demon

When in her full demon form, a pair of dark maroon horns protrude from her head, and her eyes change to have red sclera with white irises and slit pupils; thin black streaks also appear across each eye. Her eyelashes become much longer and thicker, resembling butterfly wings.

Her fingers turn mostly black and become sharp and claw-like. She also gains a long black demonic tail with spikes and a triangular tip with a red heart on the center.

In order to block Adam's punch, Charlie's arm became large, dark red and demonic with light red markings and longer black fingers.

Pilot

In the pilot, Charlie's hair was instead kept into a low-loose ponytail, her cheeks were a paler shade of red, and her eyes sported black pupils.

Her jacket instead was a pale red with black lapels, her dress-shirt included black cuffs, and her pants were black with pale red cuffs and two light yellow buttons located at the waist.

Personality

Charlie is compassionate and empathetic to a fault, feeling genuinely upset at the idea of harm coming to others.

Although she isn't unaware that Hell is populated with souls that have committed egregious acts in their living lives, she still views their yearly extermination as a senseless waste and makes it her personal mission to help them avoid it via self-betterment and eventual redemption, something she is seemingly alone in believing is possible.

Charlie's idealism, while setting her apart from many of her hellborn peers, can also make her na√Øve to many of the harsh realities that appear to stand in the way of her potential success - something her girlfriend, Vaggie, tries to remind her of, only to be cheerfully ignored in favor of a more blinkered, sunny optimism.

This can also cause her to rush headlong into the initial stages of her plans without much preparation (her prompt list before her big news appearance reading only "unicorn kisses, dolphin high fives, sing showtunes = happy ending?"). Another insurance is in "Masquerade", when she wanted to talk to Valentino about cutting Angel's work hours only to cause distraction and accidentally caused a fire on set.

Charlie has a love for musical theatre, song and dance, and will often convey her emotions and ideas through showtunes and ballads. She appears to take perceived failures hard, as she believes her heartfelt theatrical passion should be enough to bring people over to her way of thinking, and is disheartened when it's not as simple as she imagines. She openly admits during a dejected voicemail to her mother that she doesn't actually know what she is doing, or how to make her plan for reforming sinners work in practice.

Despite being sweet and lacking "street-smarts", this doesn't make Charlie a pushover or stupid. When people insult her or openly mock her ideals and plans, she has no hesitation in standing up for herself, or even rolling up her sleeves to physically fight back. When she witnessed Valentino abusing Angel, Charlie got furious to the point of turning into her demon form, but was stopped by Angel. Swearing is also something that's generally not part of her vocabulary and she doesn't cuss all the time,[20] but she is not above letting a few cuss words slip.

Charlie also displays some grounding in her idealism, understanding that not all demons can be redeemed, or even likely to change for the better. She displays sensible hesitation when confronted with an ambiguous deal from Alastor, the notorious Radio Demon, refusing the shake his hand and using her status to make demands of him (albeit with some sheepishness). She also admits that Adam is a asshole and how heaven doesn‚Äôt listen to her pleads.

Charlie is also a believer of second chances and mercy. Like in "Radio Killed the Video Star" when she found out that Sir Pentious was acting as a spy for the Vees, Charlie was the only one willing to give him a second chance when he was caught and regretful for what he had done. In "The Show Must Go On", despite hating Adam, especially after he vaporized Sir Pentious, Charlie was willing to give him mercy when Lucifer was beating him and about to hit him with a fireball.
Abilities

Immortality - As demonic royalty, and as mentioned by Adam in "The Show Must Go On", Charlie is biologically immortal, presumably being able to live for a long period of time and only able to be killed by angelic weaponry.
Charlie blocking Adam's punch
Charlie blocking Adam's punch with a demonic arm
Demon transformation - Charlie can enter a fearsome, more powerful Demon form.[9]
Demonic arm - In "The Show Must Go On", Charlie's arm became large and demonic, and with it she blocked Adam's punch with ease.
Pyrokinesis - Charlie is able to summon fire at will, shown able to erupt flames from the ground, which become a fiery tornado around herself when transforming into her full demon form. She also set Tom Trench on fire (albeit offscreen) during her brawl at 666 News.
Pyrotechnic generation - The pyrotechnics shown during I'm Always Chasing Rainbows were summoned from the palm of Charlie's hand. She later produced them from her finger against the Exorcists in "The Show Must Go On".
Glitter generation - Charlie is able to generate glitter from her hands, which she threw at an Exorcist in "The Show Must Go On".
Demonic magic - Being the daughter of Lucifer, Charlie can access powerful magic that is exclusive to the higher-ranking demons.[21]
Sorcery - In the Finale of "The Show Must Go On", Charlie cast a sparkly golden magic which lit up a row of newly installed lights.
Conjuration - Charlie can summon objects out of thin air, such as her Hazbin Hotel drawings she showed to Adam before he interrupted her. She also summoned a pitchfork in "The Show Must Go On" after transforming into her full demon form.
Skillset

Multilingualism - Charlie speaks fluent English and is said to also be able to fluently speak the Demonic languages she grew up learning.[11]
Charlie and Katie screaming
Charlie fights with Katie Killjoy
Hand-to-hand combat - As demonstrated in the Hazbin Hotel pilot, Charlie is able to hold her own when in hand-to-hand fighting. She did not hesitate to engage in a round of fisticuffs with antagonistic news caster Katie Killjoy.
Musical talent - Charlie is considered a very talented singer, even outside of the show's non-diegetic musical numbers.[3] She can also play the piano.[22]
Dancing - In addition to her musical abilities, Charlie is also a skilled dancer and a fast-learner, as shown in Alastor's Reprise, wherein she dances perfectly in sync to Alastor's steps. Charlie's personal style of dance is tap-dancing, something she can do very well.[10]
Weaponry

Shield - An intricately designed shield with Charlie used in "The Show Must Go On". Its design appears themed after Lucifer, being in the shape of an apple colored in red, and having a golden snake in the middle with six golden wings.
Pitchfork - A pitchfork Charlie conjured after transforming into her full demon form. Its design appears themed after Lucifer, with a golden snake wrapped down the length of it and a red apple at the top.
Gallery

Charlie Morningstar/Gallery
Concept & Creation

Oldcharlie
The original character, Charlie
Charlie was created during Vivziepop's time at the School of Visual Arts college,[23] and was one of the later additions to the main cast of demon misfits.

In very early proto-drafts of what would eventually become Hazbin Hotel, a red, very steampunk themed character named Charlie was created to act as a kind of "den-mother" to the demon gang that would eventually go on to become the main cast of Hazbin Hotel. The character featured an arm of molten lava that could change into various things.

Vivziepop considers this version of Charlie to be an entirely distinct entity, with a completely disparate design and personality from her current iteration. She was also not the daughter of Lucifer; she was a mortal soul, who was planned to have died in the 1830s.[24]

However, Vivziepop liked the name "Charlie" so much that she transferred it to the new character that now features as the protagonist of the current version of Hazbin Hotel, a character who then changed very little once she entered the cast.[25]
Trivia

Charlie is the only character in the main cast who is a native hellborn demon, and therefore, not having been previously human.
Demonic Charlie
Charlie's demon form shines through
When asked if Charlie has a true and full-fledged demon form, or if it only appears when she's extremely angry, Vivziepop said that she does, but would not elaborate further.[9]
Charlie has been stated to be "a tall girl" and is taller than her father, Lucifer. Not by a large amount, but still notable, with Charlie standing at around 6 feet, or over.[15][26] In a Q&A on January 31, 2024, Vivziepop stated that she is 6 and a half feet tall.[16]
Charlie's design is inspired by Vaudeville-style porcelain dolls, puppets, marionette-type things, and to a lesser extent goats. Vivziepop described Charlie's nose as being like a lamb or puppy dog, that looks very animal-like from the side, even though her character is mostly humanoid/marionette.[17]
On December 15, 2023, Vivziepop explained that Charlie is not a goat but does have hooves,[18] saying because "the devil",[19] and added that she was going for a Satyr vibe because Satyr legs have been associated with demons for a long time.[27] Her hooves are first shown in the episode "Hello Rosie!".
Despite canonically having hooves, Charlie has been depicted with human-like feet in numerous official Shark Robot Hazbin Hotel merchandise.
According to the "Clocktower Countdown to Premiere" livestream, Charlie's demeanor was heavily inspired by Leslie Knope from Parks and Rec.[28]
Charlie's lips are naturally black.[29]
Charlie apparently does not have human shaped ears.[30]
Charlie was confirmed to be bisexual by Vivziepop, who tweeted a doodle she had done for National Coming Out Day featuring Charlie with a bisexual heart.[5] She later tweeted a picture for Bi Pride Day, which featured both Charlie and Moxxie holding bisexual flags.[6]
Charlie has an ex-boyfriend, Seviathan von Eldritch. She dated him during her hell school years, and he is depicted as taking her to the prom in one of Vivziepop's illustrations of the two.[31] He is Helsa's brother, as seen in their family portraits in the background of the hotel.
Vaggie as Sally √ó Charlie as Jack Skellington
Charlie and Vaggie as Jack and Sally
Vivziepop has confirmed that Charlie and Vaggie are indeed a canon couple.[32]
She compares Charlie and Vaggie's relationship to that of Jack Skellington and Sally from The Nightmare Before Christmas.[33]
Vivziepop stated that Charlie and Vaggie have known each other for "a very long time".[34] When asked who she thinks fell for the other first (Charlie or Vaggie), Vivziepop stated that she thinks they were really good friends for a while, and it was "kind of a natural progression for them", so she doesn't really know who was in love first, thinking it was a more mutual feeling that developed between them. She also thinks that their becoming a couple happened a fairly long time prior to the events of the Hazbin Hotel pilot, and even before some events that she had planned to occur before the pilot.[35]
When asked what kind of things Charlie and Vaggie were doing before opening the hotel, Vivziepop declined to answer, mentioning she would actually love to explore this within the official comics.[36]
According to Vivziepop, Charlie sees something magical in the idea of being human. She sees it as a kind of incubation stage where they have the choice whether they go to hell or heaven. She has a very fantastical idea of what humanity is, as far as its flaws are concerned, and she likes humans, despite never having ever seen one.[37]
Vivziepop stated that Charlie would like books that have happy endings and strong characters, specifically young adult adventure books.[4]
Teenager (Charlie and Crymini)
Charlie attempts to encourage a future hotel resident
Vivziepop talked about how Charlie's attitude towards the patients of the hotel is to treat them "kind of like children". That she views them as similar to wayward teens who need righting and disciplining, and that her view of the situation is immature. Charlie doesn't take the patients' issues seriously enough, and characters that should be in therapy would simply be given a time-out. Vivziepop said that her answer to Angel's bad behavior would be to try and send him to his room.[38]
Despite Charlie's position as royalty in Hell, nobody within the sinner area of Hell respects her or her family. Dave Capdevielle explains this as there being a lack of consequences or incentive for sinners to show anyone respect, describing their view of Charlie as being like "a Disney princess". Vivziepop agrees with this assessment, adding that the royals theoretically should be respected, but that they're ruling over a group of people who don't currently respect authority, and probably didn't respect authority when they were alive, combined with Charlie being a completely unintimidating person.[39]
Charlie isn't the most mindful of her position on a day-to-day basis and is far too trusting of everyone, causing Vaggie to have to be more on guard for her.[40]
Charlie is said to take very much after her dad.[41]
Despite her youthful appearance, it appears that Charlie's age is a matter of question. Although Vivziepop thinks that Charlie does celebrate birthdays with the standard kind of party, she is still unsure of how demon years and time work for someone like Charlie.[42] In a later stream, Vivziepop stated that demons age in "hell years".[43] This may hint that Charlie's biological aging is different from how humans age, although it is unknown if hell years are similar in length to Earth years.
In one of the Hazbin Hotel pilot teasers, a portrait of the Magne family taken in the year 1871[44] hints that Charlie is decades older than she appears. Although this detail is omitted in the final version of the pilot, Faustisse has corroborated that Charlie is over 200 years old.[note 1]
According to Faustisse, both Charlie and her mother, alongside Alastor, are fans of pineapple on pizza.[note 2]
According to Dave Capdevielle, if he were to describe Charlie with a My Chemical Romance song, it would be "Sing".[45]
Charlie doll in Too Loud
Charlie doll in Too Loud
Charlie makes a cameo in an episode of Too Loud as a small doll.[46] According to Vivziepop, this is the first Hazbin Hotel easter egg.[47]
A bootleg plush of Charlie can be seen on Emberlynn's shelf in the Helluva Boss short "Mission: Weeaboo-boo".
In an interview, Erika Henningsen explained that in the songs written by Sam Haft and Andrew Underberg the way she sounds as Charlie is like a rebel Disney princess that drops an F-bomb in the middle of the most delightful melody you've ever heard.[48]
Charlie's demonic hand
Charlie's demonic arm
As seen in "The Show Must Go On", Charlie's arm became large, dark red and demonic with light red markings and black fingers. This is a reference to her original design from ZooPhobia having a similar arm.
In a mid-2024 interview, Vivziepop confirmed that Charlie and Lucifer Morningstar can travel across the Rings of Hell.[49]
She shares the same voice actor as Bethany Ghostfucker from Helluva Boss's episode, "Ghostf**kers".
For her audition as Charlie, Erika Henningsen performed the song Somewhere Over the Rainbow from the 1939 film The Wizard of Oz.[50]
Development

The character of Charlie was created as one of Vivziepop's characters during her time at the School of Visual Arts.[51]
In the Hazbin Hotel pilot, Charlie's family name was "Magne". A new last name, or possibly suffix name, for Charlie was announced on February 22, 2022, as "Morningstar".[1] This is likely a reference to her father, Lucifer, whose name is translated as "shining one" or "morning star" by many Biblical scholars.
Charlie's name in the pilot seems to have been a pun on "Charlemagne", the King of the Franks and the first Holy Roman Emperor, and a play on the translation of "The Great".
The hotel's (managed by Charlie and Vaggie) now-archived Voxtagram account username "@hotel_magnement" is a pun on the word "hotel management" combined with the former's then-surname, Magne.
In a stream, Faustisse believed that both Charlie and her father have the ability to summon wings and are capable of flight.[note 3] This has been showcased by Lucifer but is yet to be seen from Charlie in the series.
